intro: Malanea chimantensis, commonly known as the Chimanté Mountain Malanea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in shades of red and purple. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in cloud forests and rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
